You beat me to it ^_^ I noticed it too...the Hijikata ends up 
looking like the Fuun Shinsengumi Hijikata...so many Japanese 
messageboards like to say "its impossible he, like other lefties 
would've had to conform to the widespread etiquette of the time 
period" etc etc etc...besides the "shirts off" mode I also recommend 
the fundoshi only mode after you have accumulated a certain number 
of points and so forth....

If it is like Dynasty Warriors (where you can increase the 
skill/intelligence of your bodyguards not to mention their 
weapons)...maybe in this new Shinsengumi game you can improve on 
your squad's capabilities and give orders and employ strategies...oh 
the possibilities...squeal


--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "unsafesects" <mindglue@i...> wrote:
> --- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "secretary" <secretarytocapt3@h...> 
wrote:
> > Not bad...if it has some of the detail seen in such games as 
Soul 
> > Calibur 1&2 or Onimusha then it'll be awesome...I noticed that 
the 
> > uniforms have elements of the Gohatto design...
> > 
> > Many games allow for the customization of uniforms...e.g. 
Dynasty 
> > Warriors 4...I wonder if this game has that feature...in which 
case 
> > fangirls may choose the "no shirts" option LOL! ^_^
> 
> 
> I am very amused by the fact that they remembered to put Saitou's 
> katana on the righthand side so he can draw with his left hand.
> 
> Perhaps I should not be scrutinizing these pictures as much as I 
am.
> 
> Angrybee
